messages.body:
$AAPL Apple sees iPhone panic buying before Trump tariffs take effect- Bloomberg 
 
Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) saw a spike in retail traffic over the weekend as customers rushed to buy iPhones ahead of expected price hikes tied to President Trump‚Äôs new tariffs, Bloomberg reported. Store employees across multiple U.S. locations said shoppers were concerned that iPhone prices would rise sharply, given that roughly 90% of Apple‚Äôs flagship device is produced in China. The iPhone, Apple‚Äôs top-selling product, is now in the crosshairs of the ongoing trade dispute.

$SPY The only way we are going to know what direction we go is by tarrif news. Nobody can predict the future, everybody's making an educated guess at this point. Think we are screwed and max tarrifs for China ? Then buy puts... If u think we can make an agreement with China then buy calls. All this bickering is just political at this point but bottom line is the tarrifs had to be done we were obviously being taking advantage of. May hurt short term but pretty sure all sides can come to some kinds agreement in the end. That's my guess $aapl $qqq $msft
